I don't have insights into walmart's future plans, but i can offer some possible technologies that walmart may consider to stay ahead of the game:

1. artificial intelligence (ai) and machine learning: ai can help retailers to better understand customer behavior and preferences, which can ultimately lead to improved sales and profitability. walmart could use ai to analyze data from its vast network of stores and online channels to gain insights into customer preferences and recommend products to shoppers.

2. blockchain technology: blockchain can help walmart to improve transparency and traceability in its supply chain. by using blockchain, walmart can track products from the manufacturer to the consumer, which can help to prevent fraud and improve product safety.

3. robotics: by using robots in its supply chain, walmart could automate many processes, reduce errors, and improve efficiency. walmart could use robots in its warehouses and distribution centers to sort and package products.

4. internet of things (iot): by using iot devices, walmart can collect and analyze data from its stores, trucks, and supply chain to gain insights into customer behavior and inventory management. for example, walmart could use iot sensors to track the temperature and humidity of perishable goods during transport.

overall, walmart is likely to continue to invest in cutting-edge technologies to improve its supply chain management and stay ahead of the competition in the future.
